summary:
Currently studying International Business Administration and actively participating in the Enactus organization at Tilburg University with previous work experience in marketing and distribution departments at the FNA Group in Singapore, and sales and accounting departments at Schaeffler in Germany.

Keen on pursuing a Marketing Management oriented career with special interest in Strategic Development, while concurrently maintaining an open mindset as I progress in my academic disciplines.

projects.title: Life Skills Workshop Participant
projects.description:
From March 15 to April 11.
Highly interactive career essential soft skills workshop led by Dr. Maharaj and Letizia Grigo, a Positive Psychology and Well-being master's student.
5 workshop sessions in 5 weeks specialized in Communication skills basics, Interpersonal communication and social skills, Teamwork and collaboration, Cognitive skills, and Authentic leadership, respectively.

profile_positions.description:
In this internship I work together with the Global Brand Manager of The Jelly Bean Factory (TJBF) as a full member of the International Marketing team with real full-time-like responsibilities as if I was a full-time employee. This way I can have the greatest influence on the brand and make the most positive contributions to the team. 
Together with the GBM, in this role I am partly responsible for the brand's identity and positioning. Furthermore, unlike a traditional local marketing role, I am also actively engaged in the development and execution of the brand strategy, along with making important contributions to the international growth of the brand and supporting its local markets/partners.
Example responsibilities and activities include (not limited to):
- Supporting the GBM in developing marketing materials, campaigns, and setting up activation plans
- Briefing & guiding creative agencies in content development like promotional/ad videos, campaigns, packshots, atmospheric images, etc.
- Setting up and rolling out an effective E-Com and Q-Com strategy, + supporting pilot supervision
- Identifying and capitalizing on brand growth opportunities, + supporting the development and optimization of the marketing mix
- Undertaking consumer research + analyzing brand, product and campign performance
- Helping develop new products (NPD) and formats
- Developing & approving artworks (packaging)
- Organizing trade events & creating trade presentations
- Supporting local markets
profile_positions.title: International Marketing & Brand Management Intern @ The Jelly Bean Factory

profile_positions.description: I worked as an intern in the Schaeffler Headquarters in Herzogenaurach from the 17th of June 2019 to the 28th of June 2019 (2 weeks). In this internship I was situated in the Accounting and Sales Management department where I learnt about the mechanisms and demand of the Office workplace in a multi-national corporation. I learnt more than just elements of the work environment and aspects of my department, but also general guidance on finding the perfect course or profession to pursue in the future. I also learnt about vital basics on Economics to prepare me for the future IB subject, and also aspects of the business and economics in a multi-national corporation with first hand experience to these elements. All the valuable lessons I learnt and experiences I had, I stored in a Journal Document I wrote to be able to reflect and evaluate on them in the future.
profile_positions.title: Accounting and Sales Management Intern

profile_positions.description: In this work experience, I worked as an Intern for the FNA Group (which the Cocoa Trees is a subsidiary of) in their Singapore Headquarters. The FNA group is a company which exports and imports chocolate and other sweets, from other countries to other countries, from warehouse to shops with care and efficiency. I worked from the 12 March 2018 to the 23 March 2018, from Monday to Friday with 9am - 6pm working hours, as an intern in multiple different departments in the company like logistics, distribution, marketing, retailing and sales throughout the two weeks. This gave me a great insight onto how a professional career would look like and I am very appreciative towards my employers whom treated me with great respect which permitted me to integrate comfortably on my first experience working at a workplace environment.
profile_positions.title: Multi-Field Student Internship

volunteer_experiences.description:
Enactus is an international non-profit organization that believes investing in students who take ENtrepreneurial ACTion for others creates a better world for US all. Enactus values integrity, passion, innovation, and, collaboration in all that is done in their organization. They use the United Nations 17 Sustainable Development Goals (or Global Goals) as a framework to engage future NextGen Leaders to fulfill their vision of creating a better, more sustainable world. These Global Goals are used as a framework for businesses that are born and developed in so called, "ThinkTanks". I am an active member of one of the ThinkTanks in Enactus Tilburg and we are currently focused in one of our projects titled, “CrayCycle!” Here one develops soft skills like for example; creativity, persuasion, collaboration, adaptability, time management, presenting; and hard skills like for example; competitive strategies, project management, people management, customer service mechanics, marketing strategies, execution strategies. Furthermore, as a social entrepreneur, you will have the opportunity to present Enactus on Regional and National competitions.
Enactus Tilburg University is the Enactus for the city of Tilburg. It is a non-profit student organization focused on social entrepreneurship aiming to bring together students who are committed to using entrepreneurial action for the greater good. This not only leaves a direct positive impact, it helps students develop the kind of talent and perspective that is essential for leadership in an ever-more complicated and challenging world. 

For more information, visit enactus.org.

The Janti Litterers stands for "Jogging anti-litterers", it is a CAS Group at the Franconian International School founded by my friend and I, in the intent to interest high school students to engage in supporting our local environment around our school and become more environmentally conscious. The CAS group focuses on ways to support the local Erlangen environment and actively acts against littering. We do so, by going into the local Buckenhofer Forst and collecting litter, cleansing the Forest from pollution preventing this litter from affecting animals, and the nature whom live in this environment, and also from affecting one's well-being when walking or exercising in the forest.

This is a CAS Group at the Franconian International School, where a group of students work together in weekly meetings to plan fundraising events and in-school time fundraising events where a product is sold (Hot Chocolate). This non-profit project gathers all profits made throughout a certain period of time and then sends out all the profits made towards children at a local school in San Carlos, Nicaragua, thus the name, Nicraconia.

I attended an event called, "Keep clean, Singapore!" in Cashew Road organised by the Public Hygiene Council of Singapore. The event consisted of a few supervisors providing equipment to pick up the trash and different recyclable sacks to dispose of the litter, and volunteers cleaning up a relatively busy road (Cashew Road). I collected about two whole sacks of recyclable litter and one whole sack of non-recyclable litter in the span of about 3 hours.
